abstract: Japanese Parliament moves closer to passing contentious law that would ease restrictions on its military imposed by United States after World War II; demonstrators committed to preserving country's pacifism gather outside Parliament, while inside, lawmakers from party of Prime Min Shinzo Abe are forced to form human wall to keep opposition from disrupting vote.
lead_paragraph: Scenes reminiscent of a rugby match played out in the chamber where lawmakers have been debating a plan to loosen limits on the nation’s armed forces.

headline.main: Japan Military Bills Provoke Scuffling in Parliament
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Scuffle in Japan Over Measures to Loosen Limits on Military

snippet: Scenes reminiscent of a rugby match played out in the chamber where lawmakers have been debating a plan to loosen limits on the nation’s armed forces.
